front.title: Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) Content Constraints X.509 Certificate Extension

abstract.t: This document specifies the syntax and semantics for theCryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) content constraints X.509certificate extension. This extension is used to determine whetherthe public key in an X.509 public key certificate is appropriate touse in the processing of a protected content. In particular, the CMScontent constraints certificate extension is one part of theauthorization decision; it is used when validating a digitalsignature on a CMS SignedData content or validating a messageauthentication code (MAC) on a CMS AuthenticatedData content or CMSAuthEnvelopedData content. The signed or authenticated content typeis identified by an ASN.1 object identifier, and this certificateextension indicates the content types that the certified public keyis authorized to validate. If the authorization check is successful,the CMS content constraints certificate extension also providesdefault values for absent attributes.
